statement.tex: \\ %text \textbf{Right or wrong? } The following is true for \[ \dfrac{x^2}{(x^2 + 4)\cdot (x^2 +9)} \] %

\\ %text \textbf{Right or wrong? }Given that \[\dfrac{x^2}{(x^2+4)\cdot(x^2+9)} = \frac{B}{x^2+4} + \frac{D}{x^2+9}\], the values of $B, D$ and therefore \[ I = \int\dfrac{x^2}{(x^2+4)\cdot(x^2+9)}\cdot dx\] are as follows. %

reason.tex:
\begin{align} \dfrac{x^2}{(x^2+4)\cdot(x^2+9)} &= \frac{B}{x^2+4} + \frac{D}{x^2+9}\\ \implies x^2 &= B\cdot(x^2+9) + D\cdot(x^2+4) \\ &= (B+D)\cdot x^2 + (9B+4D) \end{align} %text
On comparing coefficients, one can see % \begin{align} B+D &= 1 \text{ and } 9B + 4D = 0 \\ \implies B &= -\frac{4}{5}\text{ and } D = \frac{9}{5} \\ \therefore I &= \int \dfrac{x^2}{(x^2+4)\cdot(x^2+9)}\cdot dx \\ &= -\frac{4}{5}\int\frac{dx}{x^2+2^2} + \frac{9}{5}\int\frac{dx}{x^2+3^2}\\ &=\underbrace{\frac{1}{5}\cdot\left[ 9\cdot\frac{1}{3}\tan^{-1}\frac{x}{3} -4\cdot\frac{1}{2}\tan^{-1}\frac{x}{2}\right]}_{\int\frac{dx}{x^2+a^2} = \frac{1}{a}\tan^{-1}\frac{x}{a}+C} + C\\ &= \frac{1}{5}\cdot\left[ 3\tan^{-1}\frac{x}{3} - 2\tan^{-1}\frac{x}{2}\right] + C \end{align}
